instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> starts only in smc bypass
threads.message:
it had small water damage, it was powering on before, it had a broken screen also

i cleaned it out now it wont power on only with smc bypass

only small corrosion i see is <CAPACITOR>C1910</CAPACITOR> but the <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> is 3.3V present, <CAPACITOR>C5021</CAPACITOR> next to smc

i removed those caps, same
reflowed SMC, same

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> starts only in smc bypass
threads.message:
smc not enabling 3.3v at <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> but if i keep reconnecting the charger than sometimes it does, and the board kinda turns on but only with 0.5A and the fan wont start, in smc bypass it turn on with 0.7A and fan

i replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, same, the 10 ohm resistors are good and the area is not water damaged

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> starts only in smc bypass
threads.message: ok it works with the battery only, i tried the board out of the chassis, after cleaning it works fine, those tricky <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> laptops, most of them works without the battery, this one needed it

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> starts only in smc bypass
threads.message:
Did you test with original Magsafe 2 charger from the first time?
Does it work on charger only now?
